caption: We were very lucky to be able to visit just a few days after opening. The restoration work that's been done is amazing. So bright, clean and fresh. The atmosphere is beautiful. What a joy to have visited and experienced it.

Since it was not open due construction due to a fire. I did not feel it was worth going. I did see the outside it is very detailed and very unique. Feel uncultured when I mistake it for other cathedrals close but once I saw it, it is one of the most detailed structures ever. So many statues and markings. It is one of the iconic places in Paris to visit. So my suggestion is if after all the fencing is taken down after construction to walk around the building it is very interesting.

Stunning.. once in a lifetime experience.  The museum inside (ticket 10 euro) worth the visit. We were very fortunate to have a chance to visit this iconic place üôèüèº  Tips: come as early as you can to avoid long queues. We arrived around 8.45am and the queue still light and you can have some peaceful time inside.

We visited Notre-Dame yesterday during our trip to Paris. What an amazing job that has been done on the restoration of the cathedral. It was simply breath taking. We did not have tickets and only waited in line about 10 minutes. I was amazed. It was very crowded, but everyone was orderly waiting to move around the cathedral. The restoration that was done is spectacular. The lights, statues, paintings everything is just simply beautiful. We loved our visit and are so grateful and blessed to have been able to visit Notre-Dame so close to the reopening. This is a MUST see when in Paris.

I got Lucky and could enter the cathedral. It was reopened on December 2024. It's absolutely stunning. The interior is as beautiful as the outside. The glass mosaics are surreal. It's free to enter and you can see the mass if you want to. Unfortunately it's still not allowed to go upstairs to see the view.

It‚Äôs hard to believe that this amazing cathedral was built several hundred years ago.  Here‚Äôs the scoop on visiting: we were able to show up and wait in line for about 15 minutes, go through security, then we were able to walk around the entire cathedral without any sort of ticket or any cost. We went on a Monday at 4 PM in December.  I was surprised at how minimalist and clean it was inside. The white marble was gleaming and it felt very modern. I‚Äôm glad that we went.

Visited outside 2 nights before she reopened. So many people on the streets, excited to this lovely old girl restored. Many thanks to all who donated and worked on this amazing project. Hope to tour inside soon, so lovely!!

There are two lines,  one for people w online reservation which is free but hard to get.   You can also just line up.  It is moving quite fast.  The renovated inside is very nice,  especially the blue stain glass.

I visited the cathedral during its reconstruction period. Even from the outside, it was so spectacular that I couldn‚Äôt even begin to imagine how it would look inside. Now that it‚Äôs finally been opened, I hope to come here again and take a tour of the interior.

I was very fortunate to get to visit the cathedral a few days after the reopening and would highly recommend it. It was always a highlight for me and now even more do. It is magnificent. It is so bright and the lighting makes it much easier to see all the details.. Absolutely beautiful.

Paris‚Äô famous cathedral. Due to the fire in 2019, the church is still undergoing restoration work. For now, there is a gallery erected to the side where you can view the front part of the building. There are some monuments in the yard. The cathedral is close to several other attractions and is located next to the river. My first visit to the inside of the church was in 1999. I can‚Äôt wait to visit again hopefully when the cathedral will be open to the public. It is free to access the gallery/stand.

When we reached here in the evening there was a big queue to enter inside so we had no choice but to see from outside. The cathedral was beautiful piece of architecture. There was a lovely garden in the front where one can sit and enjoy excellent view. This review is before fire incident.

Such a beautiful and iconic piece of history. We were lucky to be here the week it opened for the first time after the fire. It is try Tilynn to see the restoration, no expense was spared if your around, make sure to stop by and view the beauty of this great building.

A Timeless Beauty, Even During Renovation The Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris remains one of the most enchanting and impressive landmarks, even though it is currently closed for renovations following the fire in 2019. The cathedral‚Äôs stunning Gothic architecture and intricate details continue to captivate visitors from the outside, making it a worthwhile sight to behold.  Visiting this iconic site allows you to feel the history and charm of Paris. While entry to the interior is not possible, tourists can still enjoy the views and take photos from the surrounding areas, which remain vibrant and lively, reflecting the enduring spirit of this historic landmark.

Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris  **Notre-Dame Cathedral** is one of the most famous historical and religious landmarks in the world. Here are some key details about it:  1. **History**: - Construction of the cathedral began in 1163 and continued until 1345. - It was built in the Gothic architectural style and is considered a symbol of Gothic architecture in France.  2. **Architectural Features**: - **Towers**: It has two towers that reach a height of about 69 meters. - **Stained Glass Windows**: The cathedral features stunning medieval stained glass windows that tell religious stories. - **Facade**: The facade is adorned with intricate statues and detailed carvings.  3. **Historical Events**: - The cathedral has witnessed many significant events, including the coronation of Napoleon Bonaparte in 1804. - It suffered extensive damage due to a fire in 2019, which led to the collapse of the roof and spire.  4. **Visiting**: - The cathedral is a popular tourist destination, attracting visitors from around the world. - Visitors can explore the interior, including altars and smaller chapels. - **Reopening**: Notre-Dame Cathedral is expected to reopen to the public on December 7, 2024.  5. **Restoration**: - Following the fire, significant efforts have been made to restore the cathedral, with plans to return it to its original state.  Tips for Visiting: - Check the visiting hours and any restrictions or updates regarding restoration work. - It is advisable to book in advance if there are guided tours or special activities.  Notre-Dame Cathedral represents an important part of France's cultural and religious heritage, and it is definitely worth a visit.

Wonderful cathedral with a rich history that is under renovation and rejuvenation now because of a massive fire that broke out in 2019. I went anyway because I wanted to take a look at it now, but happy to know that it will be reopened December 2024. Look out for the lovely music from street buskers, little shops along the cathedral and a photographer who takes photos of you and prints it into a newspaper-like feature that's a lovely souvenir. You pay as you like, and can don't pay too, but I paid ‚Ç¨5 and got 3-4 shots. Lovely around Notre Dame!
Went here last week a few days after the re-opening. It was cold and drizzly but well worth the visit. The inside was warm, welcoming, and amazing. The restoration job was fantastic.

Visited while the reconstruction of the Notre Dame was still ongoing. Seeing it being reconstructed after the fire was incredible and the boards they have erected around the road side of the Cathedral was very interesting to read and see the progress so far. The spire reconstruction including the wood and craftsmanship used was good to see. I can‚Äôt wait to come back when it‚Äôs all done and open again.

Words cannot afford to describe the wonderful hands of God which has renovated the church. In my opinion all the details are taken into consideration and measures have been placed to conserve the tradition and culture. I am pleased to be here for the 3rd day of mass after it's reopened.

Most of the pictures taken after 2019 will include Tower Cranes that are on site helping in the restoration of the structure due to the devasting fire of that year. Although access is very limited, tourist still flood to the area in order to at least capture a photo of what remains. Luckily the two main columns and the front window are still standing tall and can be seen clearly.

This is such a beautiful Cathedral, but it still under reconstruction after the fire.  This is one of the most iconic monuments in France and it will be re-opening on 2025  We just have the opportunity to see it from the bleachers and walk around, but we will define you come back after the construction is done üôè

I mean, crazy. Hearing about it and seeing it online is so much different than seeing it in person. Especially after the rebuild, the amount of people around and everyone just being happy to be there and to see the building was a good experience. Loved it!

Notre-Dame is a true masterpiece of architecture and history. The intricate details of the cathedral, both inside and out, are absolutely stunning. Even though it's under restoration, the beauty and significance of this iconic monument are still incredibly moving. A must-see in Paris!

One of the most beautiful places in Paris and one of the most beautiful cathedrals I have seen in France. I think it will reopen very soon so follow up. I visited inside many years ago but also from the outside it is magnificent.

Notre Dame cathedral is a must-see whilst in Paris. Either book your entrance time online or get there early. Queues without reservation were around 3 sides of the courtyard!  Reservation and entrance is free. There are audio guides to rent, but you can also download the Notre Dame de Paris App from playstore that gives you the exact same audio tour on your phone.  The tour is available in multiple languages and was very good. It offers insight into the various parts of the cathedral as you follow a path of Christ's life. I visited just 1 week after the official reopening after the devastating fire of 2019.  The restoration is amazing.  Though the tour provides no information on the damage and its repair, it would be a very interesting addition in the future. The interior is beautifully restored, and the stain glass windows and paintings look as good as new.  As it was navity, I was also privileged to see the nativity scene.  The detail of the models were very impressive. Highly recommended.

I visited while the reconstruction was still going on. The building itself is a masterpiece of architecture. The Gothic style just adds to the overall feeling of awe you get when you stand in front of it. Definitely worth to see.

It was in my bucket list but due to fire incident could not get the chance to visit this magnificent cathedral and history associated with it. It is near the Latin Quarter.  It is one of the most famous churches in the world with two huge towers and mighty flying buttresses and for a long time the main symbol of Paris, before the Eiffel Tower was built.  An island in the Seine River, it is the historical and geographical center of Paris. The Notre-Dame Cathedral was founded in 1163 by King Louis IX (Saint Louis), and the construction took more than 150 years.  Cathedral is temporarily closed for at least 5-6 years.  I took a couple of photos of this historic church and roamed along Seine River. I reached here at sunrise time, it was looking stunning.  Fact: Among other things, it was the location of Napoleon Bonaparte‚Äôs coronation in 1804 and its painting is in the Louvre Museum.

I'd have rated it higher if I was able to go inside. Currently, it's not yet open to the public due to the damage caused by the 2019 fire (it's currently September 2024 at the time of this review). It's supposedly supposed to open back up by December 08, 2024 but I'm not sure if they'll finish by then as there seems to be quite some work to be done. The architecture is beautiful.

‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ A Truly Unforgettable Experience  I feel incredibly lucky to have attended a mass at the iconic Notre-Dame Cathedral. After the tragic fire, I thought I would never again have the chance to experience the cathedral‚Äôs beauty and spiritual ambiance. Sitting there, surrounded by its history and grandeur, was a profoundly moving and humbling experience. The atmosphere during the mass was peaceful and uplifting‚Äîsomething I will cherish forever. Notre-Dame is not just a place; it‚Äôs a symbol of resilience and faith, and I‚Äôm so grateful to have been part of such a special moment.
Enjoy the nice architecture and design.  Step into the history of a wpunderful place..  Easy access by train and hop on hop off bus.

Wonderful cathedral with a rich history that is under renovation and rejuvenation now because of a massive fire that broke out in 2019. I went anyway because I wanted to take a look at it now, but happy to know that it will be reopened December 2024.

The cathedral was closed due to restoration work. It looked beautiful from the outside. It is located near the Seine river. The area around the cathedral is quite vibrant with shops and restaurants. Hopefully this will open by year end for the public.
While you still can't go inside, as the rebuild is still ongoing, it is still worth stopping to see the gorgeous front facade They have set up a viewing stand so you can get a decent view. Lovely.

Such an amazing cathedral!  Wonderful to see the progress of the restoration.  I couldn‚Äôt help but stop & sit, and worship God for all the years that magnificent church has been in service to so many people.  Thankful to all the donors as well.
Am still in awe at how it has been rebuilt in just 5 hours. Breathtaking and congratulations to Paris for this historic structure to be back in use.

Reserving tickets in advance is the way to go, We didn't have any wait time. The insides are beautiful, it's a must do but if you have seen churches of this style don't expect to be wowed it's a church, with columns and stain glass windows.

Notre Dame Cathedral: A Timeless Masterpiece Notre Dame Cathedral is a Gothic architectural marvel that has captivated visitors for centuries. Located on √éle de la Cit√© in Paris, France, this iconic cathedral is a testament to the skill and artistry of medieval builders. Key features of Notre Dame include: Stunning architecture: The cathedral's intricate details, soaring arches, and stained glass windows create a breathtaking atmosphere. Historical significance: As a place of worship and a symbol of Paris, Notre Dame has played a crucial role in French history. Cultural impact: The cathedral has been featured in countless works of art, literature, and film, making it a globally recognized landmark. Recent events: 2019 fire: A devastating fire in 2019 caused significant damage to the cathedral, including the loss of its iconic spire. Reconstruction efforts: Extensive restoration work is underway to rebuild Notre Dame and preserve its historical heritage. While the cathedral is currently closed to the public due to ongoing restoration, visitors can still admire its exterior and learn about its history from nearby viewpoints. Construction: Construction began in the 12th century and was completed in the 14th century. French Revolution: The cathedral suffered significant damage during the French Revolution. Restoration: In the 19th century, the architect Viollet-le-Duc oversaw a major restoration project to return the cathedral to its former glory. Cultural Impact Literature: Notre Dame has been featured in numerous literary works, most notably Victor Hugo's "The Hunchback of Notre Dame." Music: The cathedral has served as a venue for many significant musical performances and events. Whether you're a history buff, architecture enthusiast, or simply seeking a breathtaking experience, Notre Dame Cathedral is a must-visit destination in Paris
Beautiful Cathedral, it brings tears to my eyes when I remember the fire that caused such huge destruction. I will definitely come back here after this place reopens. I recommend it.
